title: Dataset methods don't resolve "./path" to current dataset
body:
I expected "./path" to be resolved when passed as a path to a dataset method.  "./" is unnecessary, but it's nice in terms of being able to `os.path.join(dirname, path)`, where dirname may be `os.path.curdir`.

But this fails.  As an example:

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import os.path as op
import tempfile
from datalad.api import Dataset

repo = tempfile.mkdtemp()
ds = Dataset(repo).create()

with open(op.join(repo, "foo"), "w") as fh:
    fh.write("ok")
ds.add("./foo")
```

```bash
% /tmp/scratch.py
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/tmpk5_0ksad
[WARNING] path not associated with reference dataset
[WARNING] path not associated with any dataset [add(/tmp/foo)]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/scratch.py", line 15, in <module>
    ds.add("./foo")
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/distribution/dataset.py", line 444, in apply_func
    return f(**kwargs)
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 470, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 458, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 446, in generator_func
    msg="Command did not complete successfully")
datalad.support.exceptions.IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully [{'message': 'path not associated with reference dataset', 'status': 'impossible', 'action': 'add', 'refds': '/tmp/tmpk5_0ksad'}, {'status': 'impossible', 'raw_input': True, 'action': 'add', 'orig_request': './foo', 'message': 'path not associated with any dataset', 'state': 'absent', 'path': '/tmp/foo', 'refds': '/tmp/tmpk5_0ksad'}]
```

The path is resolved to the current directory rather than the dataset directory.
